item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, January 27, 2025 at 2:45 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Marginalia – A search engine that prioritizes non-commercial content (59 points | 9 comments)
2. Kansas tuberculosis outbreak is now America's largest in recorded history (232 points | 168 comments)
3. Openhaystack: Build 'AirTags' – track Bluetooth devices via Apple's network (72 points | 18 comments)
4. Lessons in creating family photos that people want to keep (2018) (59 points | 22 comments)
5. Shunpo: Minimalist bash tool to make directory navigation a little bit faster (27 points | 13 comments)
6. The leading AI models are now good historians (137 points | 97 comments)
7. Show HN: 3D printing giant things with a Python jigsaw generator (59 points | 8 comments)
8. The Less People Know About AI, the More They Like It (27 points | 19 comments)
9. Qwen2.5-1M: Deploy your own Qwen with context length up to 1M tokens (122 points | 61 comments)
10. The protester's guide to smartphone security (297 points | 146 comments)
11. Using the most unhinged AVX-512 instruction to make fastest phrase search algo (109 points | 29 comments)
12. Show HN: DeepSeek My User Agent (213 points | 89 comments)
13. Amsterdam Compiler Kit for Cray X-MP (49 points | 7 comments)
14. Hyperbound (YC S23) is hiring a Founding Account Executive in SF ( | hide)
15. Astronomers delete asteroid because it turned out to be Tesla Roadster (155 points | 52 comments)
16. Autodesk partially restores old forum posts after outcry from the users (32 points | 4 comments)
17. OpenJazz is a free, open-source version of the classic Jazz Jackrabbit games (34 points | 5 comments)
18. Hard numbers in the Wayland vs. X11 input latency discussion (380 points | 259 comments)
19. The Microsoft 365 Copilot launch was a disaster (321 points | 310 comments)
20. Show HN: A new native app for 20 year old OS X (83 points | 18 comments)
21. No one is disrupting banks – at least not the big ones (96 points | 165 comments)
22. Reviving a Dead Audio Format: The Return of ZZM (77 points | 5 comments)
23. Dualities in Functional Programming (19 points | 2 comments)
24. So you wanna write Kubernetes controllers? (101 points | 55 comments)
25. Show HN: Orange intelligence, an open source alternative to Apple Intelligence (54 points | 11 comments)
26. Two Bites of Data Science in K (24 points | 9 comments)
27. AI slop, suspicion, and writing back (200 points | 165 comments)
28. Curl Project and Go Security Teams Reject CVSS as Broken (15 points | 3 comments)
29. The South Vietnamese pilot who landed a Cessna on a carrier to save his family (2019) (349 points | 168 comments)
30. The only photo of the Concorde flying at supersonic speed (96 points | 61 comments)
